results.title: Bertolucci shoots 1900
results.creator_credit: Luca Olmastroni, Daria Cinematografica and Gianni Amelio
results.brief_description: A documentary made during the shooting of Bertolucci’s “Novocento” which includes comments by Bertolucci on his attitudes to film-making as well as reflecting the particular style of this film-maker. Highlights the role of the director, his relationship with the crew and points to various film-making techniques by showing the shooting of specific scenes. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students.

results.title: Bertolt Brecht's Galileo = Galileo
results.creator_credit: Ely Landau, Joseph Losey, Cinevision Ltee and The Ely Landau Organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
From the American Film Theatre series of the 1970s comes the adaptation of the Bertolt Brecht play “Galileo”. Adapted for the screen by Barbara Bray and Joseph Losey from the English version by Charles Laughton. An all star cast tell the tale of 1600’s astronomer and scientist Galileo (Topol), his struggle with authorities and being ostracised - something which writer Brecht could identify having left Hollywood in 1947 to avoid having to testify before the House Un-American Activities Committee. Galileo comes up with the notion that the Earth revolves around the Sun - and desires astronomy become the much talked about subject of his era. He finds out about the telescope presents it as his invention to the Republic of Venice. The Papal astronomer then confirms Galileo’s discoveries much to the chagrin of the theologians of the church. So, for eight years he remained silent on his discoveries. Galileo then becomes a prisoner of the Inquisition until his death. Linking the scenes throughout are songs sung by a trio of choir boys and written captions that move the narrative through time to significant events in Galileo’s life. Cast includes Tom Conti, John Gielgud, Edward Fox, Colin Blakely, Georgia Brown, Margaret Leighton, Michael Lonsdale, Patrick Magee, John McEnery, Clive Revill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ely Landau, Joseph Losey, Cinevision Ltee and The Ely Landau Organization

results.title: Bertland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
The fastest 400 metre runner in the world in 1982 was Bertland Cameron from Spanish Town, Jamaica. Bert is studying at the University of Texas, at El Paso, and is there on an athletics scholarship which requires him to perform at his top if he wants to keep it. The pressure, and the tension it brings, continues as he prepares for the 400 metres final at the 1982 Brisbane Commonwealth Games.

results.title: Berth 24
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films and J.B. Holmes
results.brief_description: Describes the ‘turn-round’ of a ship - S.S. Bravo - which plies with freight and passengers between Hull and Gothenburg. For an army of men, from river pilot to Stevedore, each ‘turn-round’ is a test of professional skill, and a race against time if tides are to be caught and schedules kept. The film tells the story of what this means to George Moore, a foreman docker, and to a Swedish passenger who comes to England as a buyer of British goods.

results.title: Bert Newton's IMT [Live from HMAS Cerberus]
results.creator_credit: Terry Gill, National Nine Network and Bill Beams
results.brief_description: A record of the IMT live broadcast from HMAS Cerburus during Navy Week in 1970 which includes commercials. Bert Newton is joined by Lucky Star; Gaynor Bunning; Tim Evans; Johnny Walker; Alison Durban; Judy Scott; Bettina and Bryce; Miss Teen America and Patti McGrath. Commercials include: Yalumba Brandivino; Mastercut butchers; Victa mowers (Pete Smith); National vacuum cleaners; Yates lawn seeds; Remy Martin Brandy; Benson & Hedges cigarettes (Stuart Wagstaff); Capitol bread; SPC canned fruit; Ponds face cream; Ponds busy girl instant shampoo; State Savings Bank; Kraft ‘quick n easy’ dried peas (Bruce Mansfield); Cedel anti-perspirent; Monash cigarettes; Gold Medallion homes; Lipton tea bags.

results.title: Bert Flugelman: public sculptor (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Lesley Hammond, South Australian Film Corporation and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: The work of Bert Flugelman is presented, particularly the design and casting of his famous sculpture pieces in Martin Place, Sydney, in Canberra and in Adelaide. His work in other mediums, e.g. pottery and painting is also presented, demonstrating the process of sculpture construction.

results.title: Berserk 6: God's Hand Ep. 22-25
results.creator_credit: OLM, Toshio Nakatani, Toshiaki Okuno and Naohito Takahashi
results.brief_description: Episodes 22-25 (final) of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 22 Griffith is being tortured but his Hawks have not given up on him. Ep. 23 The army pursues the fleeing Hawks; Griffith is very frail; Gatsu realises the depths of his feelings for Caska. Ep. 24 As Griffith hovers between life and death, the terrible truth behind his destiny is revealed. Ep. 25 Will Gatsu and Caska become sacrificial beings, as predicted? In an attempt to save her, Gatsu faces an array of marauding beasts. Final episode of “Berserk”.

results.title: Berserk 5: Requited desires Ep. 18-21
results.creator_credit: OLM, Toshio Nakatani, Toshiaki Okuno and Naohito Takahashi
results.brief_description: Episodes 18-21 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 18 Skullduggery at court threatens Griffith’s life. Ep. 19 Gatsu needs to find his own path which puts him in conflict with Griffith. Ep. 20 Away from battle, Gatsu questions the routes his life has taken. Ep. 21 With Griffith imprisoned for treason, Koska now leads the dispirited Hawks.

results.title: Berserk 4: Devil's advocate Ep. 14-17
results.creator_credit: OLM, Toshio Nakatani, Toshiaki Okuno and Naohito Takahashi
results.brief_description: Episodes 14-17 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 14 Koska is trapped and Gatsu must face a brutal encounter with 100 soldiers. Ep. 15 Koksa has conflicted emotions about Gatsu and her devotion to Griffith. Ep. 16 With the aim of capturing Doldery, the knights face the strongest of Chuder’s army. Ep. 17 In the final battle between Midland and Chuder, the outcome means more than simply victory or defeat.

results.title: Berserk 3: White Hawk Ep. 10-13
results.creator_credit: OLM, Toshio Nakatani, Toshiaki Okuno and Naohito Takahashi
results.brief_description: Episodes 10-13 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 10 After completing a brutal assignment, Gatsu is wounded, and haunted by his actions. Ep. 11 When Griffith heads off to war, his Hawks are involved in a bloody skirmish on the front line. Ep. 12 Stranded in a cave with Gatsu, Caska relives her brutal past. Ep. 13 Wounded and trapped in enemy territory, Caska and Gatsu struggle to rejoin their battalion.
